result.execSummary:
The defendant Jason Luis Rodriguez was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • Resisting or Obstructing an Officer, a class A misdemeanor, Wisconsin Statutes 946.41(1).
  • Bail Jumping-Misdemeanor, a class A misdemeanor, Wisconsin Statutes 946.49(1)(a).

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

supervisions.notes: **05-03-16/Order modifying sentence to read accordingly: 10 months imposed and stayed 24 months of probation, seek/maintain employment, maintain absolute sobriety, undergo an AODA assessment, a mental health assessment, and anger management. All other terms of original sentence shall remain in full force and effect.

miscConds.notes: BOTH COUNTS: Submit a DNA sample; pay DNA surcharge. Court ordered that all costs and surcharge be paid at a rate of $50.00 per month beginning 12-01-15, or if not paid, convert to a civil judgment. Cash bail applied.
- Mental health assessment, and anger management.

- Undergo an AODA assessment.
- Maintain absolute sobriety.

records.addlTxt: Sentence modified 5/3/16.
Sentence modified 5/3/16.

Defendant Jason Luis Rodriguez in court with attorney Kaitlin A Lamb.  Brittany Skye Kachingwe appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Deputy Court Clerk ssm.  Statements by parties.  Filed, Stipulation for Sentence Modification.  Order for Sentence Modification signed and filed.  IT IS NOW THEREFORE ORDERED, that:
1.   The sentence in this case is modified to 10 months imposed and stayed and 24 months of probation.  Conditions of probation:  Seek/maintain employment, maintain absolute sobriety, undergo an AODA assessment, a mental health assessment, and anger management.  
2.   All other terms of the original sentence shall remain in full force and effect.

IT IS FURTHER ORDERED, that:
3.   The judgment of conviction be amended to effectuate this order.

records.addlTxt:
Defendant Jason Luis Rodriguez in court with attorney Francisco Araiza.  Joy Hammond appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Deputy Court Clerk ssm.

AS TO BOTH COUNTS:  Defendant changes his plea to GUILTY.  Defendant examined as to his plea, advised of his Constitutional rights and the maximum penalty.   Defendant advised that if not a United States Citizen, deportation is possible.  Court found that defendant knowingly, voluntarily and intelligently waived his rights.  Guilty Plea Questionnaire/Waiver of Rights and Addendum received and filed.  Parties stipulate to the complaint as a factual basis to sustain defendant's plea.  Court found defendant guilty and ordered a Judgment of Conviction be entered on the record.  

Sentencing proceeded.  Statements by the State, defense and defendant.  Court sentenced defendant to serve 9 MONTHS in the House of Correction CONSECUTIVE to EACH OTHER with credit for 6 days served AS TO COUNT 1; STRAIGHT TIME; NO ELECTRONIC MONITORING.  Court ordered the defendant to submit a DNA sample and pay the DNA surcharge.

AS TO BOTH COUNTS:  Court ordered defendant to pay ALL COSTS and SURCHARGES by 11-16-2015 or, as a penalty if not paid, convert to a civil judgment.

Defendant Jason Luis Rodriguez in court with attorney Jeff Scwarz for Francisco Araiza.  Katherine Halopka-Ivery appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Deputy Court Clerk ssm.  Attorney Araiza is in trial and unable to appear.  Court ordered case adjourned for projected guilty plea in Branch 24.  Plea/sentencing hearing scheduled for September 14, 2015 at 08:30 am.

Defendant Jason Luis Rodriguez in court with attorney Francisco Araiza.  Daniel J. Gabler appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Deputy Court Clerk ssm.  Court ordered case adjourned for projected guilty plea in Branch 24.  Plea/sentencing hearing scheduled for August 19, 2015 at 01:30 pm.
